13.text: Then it became a hotel and that was when I first visited

17.text: with my husband and was absolutely bowled over with the history,

41.text:
and it actually makes such a difference
to their lives.

45.text: Two thousand acres in the heart of the Vale of Aylesbury.

51.text: Hartwell was always intended to be one of the great gardens of England.

tranquility and solitude to escape from

62.text: So here we are at the end of Hartwells' lake.

before it disappears off up towards

105.text: Hartwell House and parkland have played an important role in the history of both

109.text:
the local area and the country for the
last thousand years.

113.text: With the care and dedication of the National Trust and your help

116.text: we can preserve this unique treasure for future generations to come.
